title: Will I pass the 6th grade if I had an F in the second semester, and I have one this semester? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t know the specifics of your school's policy around feeling great, so I can't say for sure. The best way to ascertain the potential ramifications of failing twice would be to ask the school’s faculty. I would try asking them how to avoid the problem best entirely, e.g., how not to fail. Though they may come back with the good old advice “Just study harder.” Which while true, may not be all that helpful. It may be a good idea to look up “how to study,” “how to cram for tests,” and “ how to write reports fast.” When there is ample time cramming can be very useful, around 3 to 6 weeks is frequently enough time to cram for exams even when the topic is not truly understood. Hope this helps. If you try what has suggested above, you'll probably be fine. P. S. Just to clarify what I mean by cramming. CrammingA tactic used by desperate students that need to pass a class, and by overachievers who want to ensure continues As. It can include but may not be limited to:Ending all Social media contactSystematically analyzing the structure of the class to find where their weaknesses lie.Sequestering themselves from the rest of the world and sun to study as their lives depended on it.Limiting their internet access to include only information about their classesSystematically finding answers to all practice problems asked by the teacherThis might be a bit on the extreme side, but you get the picture. There is usually a way to study harder.
